title: Cognitive Load Optimization Training Based on Medical Crisis Management Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Simulation-based training replicating real medical emergency scenarios to enhance competencies for practicing professionals

learning_goals: Learners can reduce working memory load by 20% during simulation tasks by applying a three-tier cognitive load management strategy (chunked learning, visual aids, incremental complexity increase).

Learners can execute a five-step crisis response protocol (Assess-Decide-Communicate-Act-Reassess) with 90% accuracy in crisis situations using a standardized patient simulator (High-Fidelity Manikin).
Learners can identify three cognitive load factors and propose improvement strategies during debriefing sessions after team-based simulations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
